Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
BookFunnel will not sell, rent, or lease your Personal Data to a third party. However, your Personal Data may be disclosed to service providers to help in business operations and delivery of services including email delivery services, payment processing and enforcement of terms of service agreement. Data may also be shared with persons or entities with whom you give consent for data sharing, for example, the author of the book you downloaded. Data may also be shared with third parties as deemed necessary under applicable law including responding to government authorities' requests, enforcing agreements, protecting operations, rights, privacy, safety and property. Non-Personal Data may be disclosed for any purpose and cannot be used to identify you or another person.
Data Collect:
BookFunnel collects two types of data: Personal Data and Non-Personal Data. Personal Data includes your name, email address, and IP address. Some of this Personal Data is mandatory to provide the service and if declined, the service may not be provided. Non-Personal Data such as device type, device manufacturer and model, type of browser or operating system, dates and times of use, and screen resolution is also collected. This may also include the book pages visited while on the site. Personal Data is used to provide the services, verify identity and information provided, customize your experience and provide customer service if requested. Non-Personal Data is used for purposes such as providing customer service if requested.

-Automatically Collected Information includes the type of mobile device you use, unique device ID, mobile device IP address, mobile operating system, type of mobile internet browsers used, and usage patterns.
-The application does not collect real-time precise location information.
-In collaboration with analytics companies, the Application collects information about application usage frequency and duration to understand better how it's used.
-Anonymized information about other apps you've downloaded to your mobile device, mobile websites you visit, and non-precise location information also gathers to help analyze and enable targeted advertising on the app.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
Our Privacy Policy explains how information can be shared with others on beteZION. Account settings determine what is shared on beteZION. The account settings include General, Profile, Basic Information, Contact Information, and Notification. By default, we show your username, email address, and profile picture (or an avatar if no photo is provided) on our members' page and on any contributions or comments you make. Any additional information is optional and will also be displayed on your member's page unless you change the settings. We do not sell, trade, or transfer personally identifiable information to outside parties, with the exception of trusted third parties assisting our operations who agree to confidentiality. Non-personally identifiable visitor information may be provided for marketing, advertising or other uses.
Data Collect:
We collect information when you register on our site, subscribe to our newsletter, or respond to a survey. Registration may require you to enter your name, gender, and email address, but site visiting can be done anonymously. Additional information can be provided through account settings. The information collected may be used to personalize your experience, improve our website and customer service, administer features or send periodic emails related to your order. We use cookies to recognize your browser, remember preferences, understand aggregate site traffic and interactions for future improvement. This policy applies only to information collected online.

Data Share: We do not share user data with external parties unless explicitly requested by the user. In the event of technical problems, system administrators have temporary access to raw log files. Aggregated, anonymized data on website use may be published on our servers. Data Collect: The GnuPG project collects limited usage data from its websites, primarily for resolving technical problems and meeting accounting requirements. For the donation system, we collect and store information entered by the user as well as transaction IDs. Users who subscribe to our mailing lists provide their email address and optionally, a name. Email sending and receiving data is logged for 10 days for the analysis of technical problems and spam prevention. The Bug Tracker requires user registration and collects email address and username. No individual data collection or tracking cookies are utilized.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
Voice of God Recordings (VGR) does not share, sell, rent, or trade personal information with third parties and does not disclose personal information outside VGR unless such disclosure is necessary to comply with a court order or to protect the safety and security of other users. Personal information within VGR is limited to those individuals who need access in order to provide services. However, VGR may share basic user personal information with your permission to perform services you have requested. If you choose to use the backup function in The Table, all your notes, highlights, and other table information will be uploaded to your account on VGR's servers.
Data Collect:
VGR collects basic information from all visitors to their websites, which includes browser type, language preference, referring site, additional websites requested, date and time of each visitor request, and potentially personally-identifying information like IP addresses to better understand how their website visitors use the websites and to monitor and protect the security of the websites. If an account is created, VGR collects personal information such as a user name and password, an email address, a real name, and a phone number. This information is used to create your account, provide services to you, fill out your profile, and facilitate communication with you. VGR's mobile apps may require access to personal information on your device, such as the device ID, photos/media/files, or Wi-Fi access for functionality. VGR considers your privacy important and only accesses this data as necessary for the app's operation.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
Holy Bible may share collected data for multiple purposes such as providing and maintaining the service, notifying users about changes to the service, allowing users to participate in interactive features, customer care and support, data analysis for service improvement, monitoring service usage, and addressing technical issues.
The information, including personal data, may be transferred and maintained on computers outside your jurisdiction where data protection laws may vary. If you're located outside India and choose to provide information, the data is transferred to India for processing.
Third-party companies may be employed to facilitate services, and these parties only have access to personal data to perform these tasks and must not disclose or use it for other purposes.
Legal requirements may also necessitate the disclosure of personal data, to comply with legal obligations, to protect and defend rights or property, to prevent possible misconduct in connection with the service, to protect user or public safety, and to protect against legal liability.
Data Collect:
Personal Data and Usage Data are the types of information collected. Personal Data is identifiable information you provide that can be used to contact or identify you. This data may be collected when requested while using the Service.
Usage Data is automatically collected when accessing the Service through a mobile device, it includes but is not limited to device type, unique device ID, IP address, mobile operating system, type of mobile internet browser used, unique device identifiers, and other diagnostic data.
Cookies and similar tracking technologies are used to track activity on the Service and hold certain information. These may include session, preference, and security cookies.
Your data's security is important and measures are taken to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, however, absolute security can't be guaranteed.
The service provided does not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 18. Any such data found to be collected is removed from servers.
Analytics, including third-party Service Providers like Firebase by Google Inc, may also be used to monitor and analyze the use of the Service.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
Diarium Privacy Policy states that only aggregated anonymized data is occasionally transmitted to external services to enhance the app. The app might share user information with third parties as outlined in this privacy policy. However, this does not include journal data. While using the Diarium Cloud Sync feature, user databases are uploaded to personal Cloud Storage, such as OneDrive or Google Drive, through official APIs. The third-party Cloud services have their own privacy policies. Services in the "Feeds & Events" section might be connected to augment your journal, and communication to those services is sent encrypted. No personal data is published on your behalf. Diarium accesses your daily step count and sleep data for display in journal entries but does not share this health data with others.
Data Collect:
Diarium collects information during its download and usage such as device's IP address, the Application pages visited, the time and date of visits, time spent on these pages and the operating system used on the device. User data is processed upon consent to this privacy policy, and all data collection ceases when the Application is uninstalled. The application uses Firebase, Sentry, and Mixpanel to monitor app usage, identify bugs, and rectify crashes. Default settings store the journal database on the device, but Diarium Cloud Sync can be chosen to synchronize data across devices. The "Feeds & Events" section is used to enrich your journal data, accessed through official APIs and SSL. Google Fit is used to access daily step count and sleep data when enabled in the app settings. They do not collect personal information from children under the age of 13 deliberately.

Data Share:
Our apps share the information you provide with us, including your approximate location, phone number, app interactions, and device identifiers, with third parties. This information may be shared for data analysis, advertising, marketing, security, fraud prevention, and app functionality purposes. Ads displayed in the app are provided by third-party companies, which may use and collect anonymous data about the user's interests to select more relevant ads. This may also include location data and unique device identifiers.
Data Collect:
We collect user data, such as approximate location, phone number, app interactions, performance information, and device identifiers through the use of our apps. Non-personal data, such as device model number, operating system version, and country code, are also collected for application management purposes. Google Analytics is used to gauge how users interact with our apps and guide usability improvements. This includes monitoring the amount of time spent in the app, number of screens viewed, and the location of the user. Please note, all data entered into the apps by you remains on your device; we do not have access to this data and do not use or pass on any data that you register in our applications.

Data Share:
Jsho's website and mobile application ("Service") may share your information, including Personal Data, with third-party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service ("Service Providers"). Service Providers provide the Service on our behalf, perform Service-related services, or assist us in analyzing how our Service is used. These third parties only have access to your Personal Data to perform these specific tasks and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.
Under certain legal requirements, Jsho may disclose your Personal Data if necessary to comply with a legal obligation, to protect and defend the rights or property of Jsho, to prevent or investigate possible wrongdoing in connection with the Service, to protect the personal safety of users of the Service or the public, or to protect against legal liability.
Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to — and maintained on — computers located outside of your state, province, country, or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from your jurisdiction. If you're located outside Australia and provide information to us, we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to Australia and process it there.
Data Collect:

Personal Data that may be collected includes, but is not limited to, Cookies and Usage Data. Usage Data may include your computer's IP address, browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time you spent on those pages, unique device identifiers, and other diagnostic data. When you access the Service by or through a mobile device, this Usage Data may include information such as the type of mobile device you use, your mobile device unique ID, the IP address of your mobile device, your mobile operating system, the type of mobile internet browser you use, unique device identifiers, and other diagnostic data.
We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track activity on our Service and hold specific information. Cookies are files with a small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Tracking technologies also used are beacons, tags, and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze our Service.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
The app has no internet access and does not send anything outside the device. However, if you create new contacts which are not stored locally, but synced via CardDAV, all related fields including phone numbers, emails, addresses, etc., are synced outside the device.
Data Collect:
Right Contacts does not collect any personal identifiable information. The app uses `WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE` permission, only on Android versions below 8, for importing/exporting contacts from/to .vcf files. It also uses `READ_CONTACTS` and `WRITE_CONTACTS` permissions to access and modify contact information and to create new contacts.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
We may use your information to assist orders, deliver products, process payments, communicate about orders, products, and promotional offers, update records, maintain accounts, display relevant content, recommend pertinent merchandise and services, improve our platform, prevent fraud, and permit third parties to execute logistical or technical tasks on our behalf. We use your collected details for conducting promotions (i.e., to notify winners), offering products and services, and for market research, advertising and promotional initiatives when you participate in sweepstakes or other promotions. We also utilize the information you provide in personal correspondence, messages, feedback, and third-party report about your activities on the site.
Data Collect:
We collect personally identifying information voluntarily provided by you. It includes data necessary to answer visitor queries, mail e-newsletters, and contact winners of contests and promotions. When you maintain a user account or make purchases, we collect personally identifiable information like email address, name, phone number, payment details, and intelligence about your purchase behavior. Additional data collection, such as billing address, card expiration date, tracking information from cheques or money orders, occurs when you transact with us. If you choose to post messages or leave feedback, we collect that information for dispute resolution, customer support, and troubleshooting. Personal correspondence and any other correspondences regarding your activities or postings on the Website also get collected.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
1. Bullhorn may disclose personal data to companies assisting in service provision and third-party partner firms. Sub-processors can be found at https://www.bullhorn.com/legal/sub-processors/.
2. Personal data may be shared for statistical, analytical and product/service enhancement purposes.
3. Personal data may be disclosed or distributed to a party with which Bullhorn enters into a corporation transaction such as a merger or acquisition.
4. Personal data collected may be transferred to third parties outside the state, province, country or jurisdiction where Bullhorn stores personal data, subject to compliance with applicable laws.
5. Bullhorn does not sell personal data to third parties and ensures appropriate use and access to personal data by its employees.
6. Personal data may also be transferred from Bullhorn Group Companies in the EEA, UK, and Switzerland to Bullhorn Group Companies outside these territories.
Data Collect:
1. Bullhorn collects personal data including identifiers, education and professional training data, employment data, financial data, etc.
2. Bullhorn collects personal data for its business purposes to comply with contractual and legal obligations. The data is used to provide the Service, facilitate services by third parties, keep records of customer activity and information, administer customer accounts, respond to service and support requests, provide service updates, and for marketing, promotional, data security and product/service enhancement purposes.
3. Personal data is collected from the customers, customers’ candidates and Site visitors.
4. Personal data may also be collected to comply with legal requirements or determine fitness for employment.
5. Personal data is retained for as long as required for its intended purpose or to fulfill Bullhorn's legal and contractual obligations.
6. Complaints or concerns regarding the privacy policy can be directed to the appointed Data Protection Officers.
